AuditLogPage.tsx.impact: 45+ hardcoded strings replaced with translation keys, 4 new imports added

LoginPage.tsx.pattern: Consistent useTranslation hook pattern with namespace specification
LoginPage.tsx.refactoring_details: Comprehensive translation coverage for both authentication flows and UI elements

patterns_discovered.translation_architecture: Namespace-based organization (login.*, audit.*, common.*) with dot-notation keys for hierarchical grouping
patterns_discovered.hook_usage: useTranslation(namespace) hook pattern consistently applied at component level with namespace parameter
patterns_discovered.key_naming_convention: Descriptive camelCase keys (pageTitle, searchPlaceholder, failedToLoad, todayActivity, usersActive)
patterns_discovered.interpolation_support: Template variables like {{count}} supported for pluralization and dynamic values
patterns_discovered.namespace_references: Cross-namespace references using ns parameter (t('view', { ns: 'common' }))
patterns_discovered.parallel_localization: English and Hebrew translations maintained in parallel with identical key structures

gotchas_discovered.dynamic_text_generation: String concatenation patterns (e.g., 'field changed' strings) require careful translation - extracted to variables for consistency
gotchas_discovered.uppercase_transformation: t('timestamp').toUpperCase() pattern used for label styling; translation happens before transformation
gotchas_discovered.pluralization: Manual pluralization logic for 'field(s) changed' requires language-aware handling, uses count-based templates
gotchas_discovered.namespace_switching: Components using multiple namespaces must specify ns parameter in t() calls for keys outside primary namespace
gotchas_discovered.spreadsheet_limitations: Large translation additions (41 keys) increase maintenance burden for subsequent translations
gotchas_discovered.svg_icon_labels: Empty labels on icon buttons require translation key references (t('view'))

approach_outcome.execution_strategy: Systematic namespace migration - added comprehensive translation keys first, then updated components to use translations
approach_outcome.completeness: 100% - all hardcoded strings in target pages replaced with translation keys across both languages
approach_outcome.migration_scope: Two pages (AuditLogPage, LoginPage) fully migrated from hardcoded strings to i18n namespace-based translations
approach_outcome.backward_compatibility: Successfully maintained existing component functionality while introducing translation layer

recommendations: Establish translation key naming guidelines to ensure consistency as more namespaces are added
Create a TypeScript interface/type definition for each namespace to enable IDE autocomplete and catch missing keys at compile time
Document patterns for handling pluralization (count-based templates) as it appears to be a common requirement
Consider extracting dynamic text generation patterns (like fieldText) as utility functions to centralize translation logic
Implement pre-commit hooks to validate that all .json locale files have matching key structures across languages
Add JSDoc comments documenting which translation namespace each component expects for easier maintenance
Review remaining hardcoded strings in the codebase to identify other components ready for migration using this pattern
